column8: A hidden gem near Anuradhapura - absolutely worth seeing
column11: A beautifully situated temple near A.pura, where, according to legend, the sangamita, which brought the branch of the Holy Bodhi tree from Inden to A.pura, stopped and left here a sister shoot of that tree under which the Buddha found enlightenment. Hence a very special place for Buddhists. It is located on large Granti blocks, by a lake, ie just the landscape is a dream. You don't meet tourists here, just faithful locals. A real highlight is a large lying Buddha and a sitting one carved into the rocks. A true hidden champion when UNESCO highlights are nearby

Great place to visit. If you need to cover all, probably a day requir. At least half a needs. Avoid mid day as it get more hot üî•. Beware while walking as rocks may slippery. Don't throw garbage around as wild animals can affected.

If you're visiting Anuradhapura, make sure to check out this must-visit location about 35-40 km away, rich with both historical and archaeological significance. It's best to go either early in the morning (around 7:00 AM) or late in the afternoon (after 4:00 PM) to avoid the intense heat that can make exploring difficult between 9:00 AM and 4:00 PM. Allocate about 1 to 2 hours for your visit, as there's plenty to see. Be sure to study the site map (found in one of my uploaded photos) and plan your visit accordingly. Leave the museum and the "Budhu Madura" for last, as these shaded areas can be enjoyed regardless of the heat.

column8: An Ancient Monastic Settlement going back to pre - historic time
column11: The Tanthirimale Raja Maha Viharaya is located in Anuradhapura District and boarder of Mannar District.Granite Rock,Nelum pokuna,Caves and monastic Library is the most attract things here.

column8: A sacred Buddhist temple with historical importance
column11: A Sacred Buddhist temple located bit away from Anuradhapura. The Bo tree here is said to be one of the first 8 saplings of Jaya Sri maha bo tree in Anuradhapura. Temple spans across a large area and almost all is covered with rock. Views are amazing. You have to walk some good distance to cover all the important places here. Visit in early morning or evening as walking on rock when sun is up would be very difficult to do. A large car park is there inside the temple. A museum also located inside.

1 hour drive from Anuradhapura, road condition is good. Best time is early in the morning until 10am to avoid heat. This has a Little Rock climbing to do so avoid heat yet elderly people too can reach. Exploration time is 1.5hours. Scenario ancient temple with ample parking. No entrance fee, guide is not required.

It was the first visit to this temple for my wife and the two children. I visited after about 8years. Thanthirimale Raja Maha Vihara  is in the Anuradhapura District. It is located approximately 40 km north west of the Anuradhapura city. Once upon a time this area was fully covered with jungle and an elephant country. Untill recently this temple was rarely visited due to the 30 years of civil war, difficult roads and elephants. This place was unidentified till the beginning of the 19th century, and in the 1960s the temple was re-established by Buddhist monks. The temple and surrounding area are full of ruins, including two stone statues and several stone ponds. There is an archaeological museum at Thanthirimale. This temple, which was built in the third century BC has a historical value. When the Jaya Sri Maha Bodhi was brought from India to Sri Lanka, one night along the way to Anuradhapura, the pot containing the sapling was kept at Thanthirimale. It is believed that there was one branch separately grew from the pot, was planted at that village to remember the incident. Hence, some believe that this may be the first Sri Maha Bhodi plant in Sri Lanka. The Bo Tree is placed on top of large stony layer which has protected the tree up to now.

Historical temple with amazing carvings. It is said that this place was used as one day stop to Arahath Their Sangamitta on her way to Anuradhapura, while she was bringing the ‚ÄòHoly Bo Tree & the Tooth Relic of the Buddha‚Äô from India.

column8: Our visit to ancient temple of Thanthirimale
column11: Thanthirimale is an ancient temple of Sri Lanka that should not be missed by any tourist who wishes to get some idea about the ancient history of Sri Lanka.  It is a rock temple and anybody keen on meditation, this rock temple provides a very calm and relaxing atmosphere.  There are so much to see at this site and you can certainly spend 2-3 hours without being getting tired.  The road to the Thanthirimale temple is well maintained and it is a carpeted road.  Please be aware that the maximum speed limit is 70 km per hour when you drive on that road since the road is excellent and empty and you may feel like driving much faster.  There are so many ancient artifacts and you can learn about the history dating back to nearly 2300 years or about 300 BC.
This old Buddhist temple is about an hours drive from Anuradhapura .A good Buddhist temple to spend about an hour to see.

Thanthirimale rajamaha viharayaya has long history . Its a natural rokey area .according to the written history it's history goes to 4 century  B C.up to 11 century A D. It has Buddha's storn carved status belongs to 9 century A D which similar to the polonnaruwa gal viharaya statues.the most special thing is there painting of pre historic humans can be seen in thanthirimale temple.

If you are planning to visit the temple, and explore the associated ruins and the site with the prehistoric paintings, be prepared to spend a few hours at least at Thanthirimale. It is best to go there in the early morning before the sun gets too hot.

This is one of the most historical temples with scenic views, spread over 250 Acres of high rock land. Better to visit before 9AM or After 4PM avoiding the hot sun. About 40Km away from the city of Anuradhapura. Access routes are in good condition.

We travelled early in the morning and the sun rise was amazing. We had a 360 degree view of the surrounding. We meditated for couple of hours and has  a very peaceful morning session. How much it is enticing, we spend all of our morning half there in the temple. Very calm. Must visit place. The road from Anuradhapura is good. And the road to manner is even better, but do not go at eve as elephants could block your way.
This is spiritual place among Buddhists.  very famous place. It has giant rocks around. Nice to go there after sun set. very scenic place with charming atmosphere.

One of most important and historical place of century of Anuradapura. An ancient temple built in 3rd century BC. There is historical painting and Buddhist statues (stone sculpture), Caves, ponds and long area to see wide angle.
